   20: 
   21: -module(bif_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   24: -include_lib("kernel/include/file.hrl").
   25: 
   26: -export([all/0, suite/0, init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   27: 
   28: -export([display/1, display_huge/0, display_string/1,
   29: 	 erl_bif_types/1,guard_bifs_in_erl_bif_types/1,
   30: 	 shadow_comments/1,list_to_utf8_atom/1,
   31: 	 specs/1,improper_bif_stubs/1,auto_imports/1,
   32: 	 t_list_to_existing_atom/1,os_env/1,otp_7526/1,
   33: 	 t_binary_to_atom/1,t_binary_to_existing_atom/1,
   34: 	 t_atom_to_binary/1,min_max/1, erlang_halt/1,
   35:          erl_crash_dump_bytes/1,
   36: 	 is_builtin/1, error_stacktrace/1,
   37: 	 error_stacktrace_during_call_trace/1,
   38:          group_leader_prio/1, group_leader_prio_dirty/1,
   39:          is_process_alive/1,
   40:          is_process_alive_signal_from/1,
   41:          process_info_blast/1,
   42:          os_env_case_sensitivity/1,
   43:          verify_middle_queue_save/1,
   44:          test_length/1,
   45:          fixed_apply_badarg/1,
   46:          external_fun_apply3/1,
   47:          node_1/1]).
   48: 
   49: suite() ->
   50:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   51:      {timetrap, {minutes, 1}}].
   52: 
   53: all() -> 
   54:     [erl_bif_types, guard_bifs_in_erl_bif_types, shadow_comments,
   55:      specs, improper_bif_stubs, auto_imports,
   56:      t_list_to_existing_atom, os_env, otp_7526,
   57:      display, display_string, list_to_utf8_atom,
   58:      t_atom_to_binary, t_binary_to_atom, t_binary_to_existing_atom,
   59:      erl_crash_dump_bytes, min_max, erlang_halt, is_builtin,
   60:      error_stacktrace, error_stacktrace_during_call_trace,
   61:      group_leader_prio, group_leader_prio_dirty,
   62:      is_process_alive, is_process_alive_signal_from,
   63:      process_info_blast, os_env_case_sensitivity,
   64:      verify_middle_queue_save, test_length,fixed_apply_badarg,
   65:      external_fun_apply3, node_1].
   66: 
   67: init_per_testcase(guard_bifs_in_erl_bif_types, Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   68:     skip_missing_erl_bif_types(Config);
   69: init_per_testcase(erl_bif_types, Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   70:     skip_missing_erl_bif_types(Config);
   71: init_per_testcase(shadow_comments, Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   72:     skip_missing_erl_bif_types(Config);
   73: init_per_testcase(Func, Config) when is_atom(Func), is_list(Config) ->
   74:     Config.
   75: 
   76: end_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
   77:     erts_test_utils:ept_check_leaked_nodes(Config).
   78: 
   79: %% erl_bif_types comes from dialyzer which some test runs skip building, so
   80: %% we'll skip the tests that use it as the result shouldn't vary based on
   81: %% platform. The majority build it so we'll have plenty coverage either way.
   82: skip_missing_erl_bif_types(Config) ->
   83:     c:l(erl_bif_types),
   84:     case erlang:function_exported(erl_bif_types, module_info, 0) of
   85:         false -> {skip, "erl_bif_types not compiled"};
   86:         true -> Config
   87:     end.
   88: 
   89: %% Uses erlang:display to test that erts_printf does not do deep recursion
   90: display(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   91:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
   92:     true = rpc:call(Node,?MODULE,display_huge,[]),
   93:     peer:stop(Peer),
   94:     ok.
   95: 
   96: display_huge() ->
   97:     erlang:display(deeep(100000)).
   98: 
   99: deeep(0,Acc) ->
  100:     Acc;
  101: deeep(N,Acc) ->
  102:     deeep(N-1,[Acc|[]]).
  103: 
  104: deeep(N) ->
  105:     deeep(N,[hello]).
  106: 
  107: display_string(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  108:     true = erlang:display_string("hej"),
  109:     true = erlang:display_string(""),
  110:     true = erlang:display_string("hopp"),
  111:     true = erlang:display_string("\n"),
  112:     true = erlang:display_string(lists:seq(1100,1200)),
  113:     {error,badarg} = try
  114:                          erlang:display_string(atom),
  115:                          ok
  116:                      catch
  117:                          T0:E0 ->
  118:                              {T0, E0}
  119:                      end,
  120:     {error,badarg} = try
  121:                          erlang:display_string(make_ref()),
  122:                          ok
  123:                      catch
  124:                          T1:E1 ->
  125:                              {T1, E1}
  126:                      end,
  127:     ok.
  128: 
  129: erl_bif_types(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  130:     List = erlang:system_info(snifs),
  131: 
  132:     KnownTypes = [MFA || MFA <- List, known_types(MFA)],
  133:     io:format("There are ~p BIFs with type information in erl_bif_types.",
  134: 	      [length(KnownTypes)]),
  135:     erl_bif_types_2(KnownTypes).
  136: 
  137: erl_bif_types_2(List) ->
  138:     BadArity = [MFA || {M,F,A}=MFA <- List,
  139: 		       begin
  140: 			   Types = erl_bif_types:arg_types(M, F, A),
  141: 			   length(Types) =/= A
  142: 		       end],
  143:     case BadArity of
  144: 	[] ->
  145: 	    erl_bif_types_3(List);
  146: 	[_|_] ->
  147: 	    io:put_chars("Bifs with bad arity\n"),
  148: 	    io:format("~p\n", [BadArity]),
  149: 	    ct:fail({length(BadArity),bad_arity})
  150:     end.
  151: 
  152: erl_bif_types_3(List) ->
  153:     BadSmokeTest = [MFA || {M,F,A}=MFA <- List,
  154: 			   begin
  155: 			       try erl_bif_types:type(M, F, A) of
  156: 				   Type ->
  157: 				       %% Test that type is returned.
  158: 				       not erl_types:is_erl_type(Type)
  159: 			       catch
  160: 				   Class:Error ->
  161: 				       io:format("~p: ~p ~p\n",
  162: 						 [MFA,Class,Error]),
  163: 				       true
  164: 			       end
  165: 			   end],
  166:     case BadSmokeTest of
  167: 	[] ->
  168: 	    ok;
  169: 	[_|_] ->
  170: 	    io:put_chars("Bifs with failing calls to erlang_bif_types:type/3 "
  171: 			 "(or with bogus return values):\n"),
  172: 	    io:format("~p\n", [BadSmokeTest]),
  173: 	    ct:fail({length(BadSmokeTest),bad_smoke_test})
  174:     end.
  175: 
  176: guard_bifs_in_erl_bif_types(_Config) ->
  177:     List0 = erlang:system_info(snifs),
  178:     List = [{F,A} || {erlang,F,A} <- List0,
  179: 		     erl_internal:guard_bif(F, A)],
  180:     Not = [FA || {F,A}=FA <- List,
  181: 		 not erl_bif_types:is_known(erlang, F, A)],
  182:     case Not of
  183: 	[] ->
  184: 	    ok;
  185: 	[_|_] ->
  186: 	    io:put_chars(
  187: 	      ["Dialyzer requires that all guard BIFs "
  188: 	       "have type information in erl_bif_types.\n\n"
  189: 	       "The following guard BIFs have no type information "
  190: 	       "in erl_bif_types:\n\n",
  191: 	       [io_lib:format("  ~p/~p\n", [F,A]) || {F,A} <- Not]]),
  192: 	    ct:fail(erl_bif_types)
  193:     end.
  194: 
  195: shadow_comments(_Config) ->
  196:     ErlangList = [{erlang,F,A} || {F,A} <- erlang:module_info(exports),
  197: 				  not is_operator(F,A)],
  198:     List0 = erlang:system_info(snifs),
  199:     List1 = [MFA || {M,_,_}=MFA <- List0, M =/= erlang],
  200:     List = List1 ++ ErlangList,
  201:     HasTypes = [MFA || {M,F,A}=MFA <- List,
  202: 		       erl_bif_types:is_known(M, F, A)],
  203:     Path = get_code_path(),
  204:     BifRel = sofs:relation(HasTypes, [{m,f,a}]),
  205:     BifModules = sofs:to_external(sofs:projection(1, BifRel)),
  206:     AbstrByModule = [extract_abstract(Mod, Path) || Mod <- BifModules],
  207:     Specs0 = [extract_specs(Mod, Abstr) ||
  208: 		 {Mod,Abstr} <- AbstrByModule],
  209:     Specs = lists:append(Specs0),
  210:     SpecFuns0 = [F || {F,_} <- Specs],
  211:     SpecFuns = sofs:relation(SpecFuns0, [{m,f,a}]),
  212:     HasTypesAndSpecs = sofs:intersection(BifRel, SpecFuns),
  213:     Commented0 = lists:append([extract_comments(Mod, Path) ||
  214: 				  Mod <- BifModules]),
  215:     Commented = sofs:relation(Commented0, [{m,f,a}]),
  216:     {NoComments0,_,NoBifSpecs0} =
  217: 	sofs:symmetric_partition(HasTypesAndSpecs, Commented),
  218:     NoComments = sofs:to_external(NoComments0),
  219:     NoBifSpecs = sofs:to_external(NoBifSpecs0),
  220: 
  221:     case NoComments of
  222: 	[] ->
  223: 	    ok;
  224: 	[_|_] ->
  225: 	    io:put_chars(
  226: 	      ["If a BIF stub has both a spec and has type information in "
  227: 	       "erl_bif_types, there *must*\n"
  228: 	       "be a comment in the source file to make that immediately "
  229: 	       "obvious.\n\nThe following comments are missing:\n\n",
  230: 	       [io_lib:format("%% Shadowed by erl_bif_types: ~p:~p/~p\n",
  231: 			      [M,F,A]) || {M,F,A} <- NoComments]]),
  232: 	    ct:fail(bif_stub)
  233:     end,
  234: 
  235:     case NoBifSpecs of
  236: 	[] ->
  237: 	    ok;
  238: 	[_|_] ->
  239: 	    io:put_chars(
  240: 	      ["The following functions have \"shadowed\" comments "
  241: 	       "claiming that there is type information in erl_bif_types,\n"
  242: 	       "but actually there is no such type information.\n\n"
  243: 	       "Therefore, the following comments should be removed:\n\n",
  244: 	       [io_lib:format("%% Shadowed by erl_bif_types: ~p:~p/~p\n",
  245: 			      [M,F,A]) || {M,F,A} <- NoBifSpecs]]),
  246: 	    ct:fail(erl_bif_types)
  247:     end.
  248: 
  249: extract_comments(Mod, Path) ->
  250:     Beam = which(Mod, Path),
  251:     SrcDir = filename:join(filename:dirname(filename:dirname(Beam)), "src"),
  252:     Src = filename:join(SrcDir, atom_to_list(Mod) ++ ".erl"),
  253:     {ok,Bin} = file:read_file(Src),
  254:     Lines0 = binary:split(Bin, <<"\n">>, [global]),
  255:     Lines1 = [T || <<"%% Shadowed by erl_bif_types: ",T/binary>> <- Lines0],
  256:     {ok,ReMFA} = re:compile("([^:]*):([^/]*)/(\\d*)"),
  257:     Lines = [L || L <- Lines1, re:run(L, ReMFA, [{capture,[]}]) =:= match],
  258:     [begin
  259: 	 {match,[M,F,A]} = re:run(L, ReMFA, [{capture,all_but_first,list}]),
  260: 	 {list_to_atom(M),list_to_atom(F),list_to_integer(A)}
  261:      end || L <- Lines].
  262: 
  263: known_types({M,F,A}) ->
  264:     erl_bif_types:is_known(M, F, A).
  265: 
  266: specs(_) ->
  267:     List0 = erlang:system_info(snifs),
  268: 
  269:     %% Ignore all operators.
  270:     List = [MFA || MFA <- List0, not is_operator(MFA)],
  271: 
  272:     %% Extract specs from the abstract code for all BIFs.
  273:     Path = get_code_path(),
  274:     BifRel = sofs:relation(List, [{m,f,a}]),
  275:     BifModules = sofs:to_external(sofs:projection(1, BifRel)),
  276:     AbstrByModule = [extract_abstract(Mod, Path) || Mod <- BifModules],
  277:     Specs0 = [extract_specs(Mod, Abstr) ||
  278: 		 {Mod,Abstr} <- AbstrByModule],
  279:     Specs = lists:append(Specs0),
  280:     BifSet = sofs:set(List, [function]),
  281:     SpecRel0 = sofs:relation(Specs, [{function,spec}]),
  282:     SpecRel = sofs:restriction(SpecRel0, BifSet),
  283: 
  284:     %% Find BIFs without specs.
  285:     NoSpecs0 = sofs:difference(BifSet, sofs:domain(SpecRel)),
  286:     NoSpecs = sofs:to_external(NoSpecs0),
  287:     case NoSpecs of
  288: 	[] ->
  289: 	    ok;
  290: 	[_|_] ->
  291: 	    io:put_chars("The following BIFs don't have specs:\n"),
  292: 	    [print_mfa(MFA) || MFA <- NoSpecs],
  293: 	    ct:fail(no_spec)
  294:     end.
  295: 
  296: is_operator({erlang,F,A}) ->
  297:     is_operator(F,A);
  298: is_operator(_) -> false.
  299: 
  300: is_operator(F,A) ->
  301:     erl_internal:arith_op(F, A) orelse
  302: 	erl_internal:bool_op(F, A) orelse
  303: 	erl_internal:comp_op(F, A) orelse
  304: 	erl_internal:list_op(F, A) orelse
  305: 	erl_internal:send_op(F, A).
  306:     
  307: extract_specs(M, Abstr) ->
  308:     [{make_mfa(M, Name),Spec} || {attribute,_,spec,{Name,Spec}} <- Abstr].
  309: 
  310: make_mfa(M, {F,A}) -> {M,F,A};
  311: make_mfa(M, {M,_,_}=MFA) -> MFA.
  312: 
  313: improper_bif_stubs(_) ->
  314:     Bifs = erlang:system_info(snifs),
  315:     Path = get_code_path(),
  316:     BifRel = sofs:relation(Bifs, [{m,f,a}]),
  317:     BifModules = sofs:to_external(sofs:projection(1, BifRel)),
  318:     AbstrByModule = [extract_abstract(Mod, Path) || Mod <- BifModules],
  319:     Funcs0 = [extract_functions(Mod, Abstr) ||
  320: 		 {Mod,Abstr} <- AbstrByModule],
  321:     Funcs = lists:append(Funcs0),
  322:     BifSet = sofs:set(Bifs, [function]),
  323:     FuncRel0 = sofs:relation(Funcs, [{function,code}]),
  324:     FuncRel = sofs:restriction(FuncRel0, BifSet),
  325:     [check_stub(MFA, Body) || {MFA,Body} <- sofs:to_external(FuncRel)],
  326:     ok.
  327: 
  328: auto_imports(_Config) ->
  329:     Path = get_code_path(),
  330:     {erlang,Abstr} = extract_abstract(erlang, Path),
  331:     SpecFuns = [Name || {attribute,_,spec,{Name,_}} <- Abstr],
  332:     auto_imports(SpecFuns, 0).
  333: 
  334: auto_imports([{F,A}|T], Errors) ->
  335:     case erl_internal:bif(F, A) of
  336: 	false ->
  337: 	    io:format("~p/~p: not auto-imported, but spec claims it "
  338: 		      "is auto-imported", [F,A]),
  339: 	    auto_imports(T, Errors+1);
  340: 	true ->
  341: 	    auto_imports(T, Errors)
  342:     end;
  343: auto_imports([{erlang,F,A}|T], Errors) ->
  344:     case erl_internal:bif(F, A) of
  345: 	false ->
  346: 	    auto_imports(T, Errors);
  347: 	true ->
  348: 	    io:format("~p/~p: auto-imported, but "
  349: 		      "spec claims it is *not* auto-imported", [F,A]),
  350: 	    auto_imports(T, Errors+1)
  351:     end;
  352: auto_imports([], 0) ->
  353:     ok;
  354: auto_imports([], Errors) ->
  355:     ct:fail({Errors,inconsistencies}).
  356: 
  357: extract_functions(M, Abstr) ->
  358:     [{{M,F,A},Body} || {function,_,F,A,Body} <- Abstr].
  359: 
  360: check_stub({_,F,2}, _B) when F =:= min; F =:= max ->
  361:     %% In Erlang/OTP 26, min/2 and max/2 are guard BIFs. For backward
  362:     %% compatibility with code compiled with an earlier version, the
  363:     %% Erlang implementation of them is kept.
  364:     ok;
  365: check_stub({_,F,A}, B) ->
  366:     try
  367: 	[{clause,_,Args,[],Body}] = B,
  368: 	A = length(Args),
  369: 	[{call,_,{remote,_,{atom,_,erlang},{atom,_,nif_error}},[_]}] = Body
  370:     catch
  371: 	_:_ ->
  372: 	    io:put_chars("Invalid body for the following BIF stub:\n"),
  373: 	    Func = {function,0,F,A,B},
  374: 	    io:put_chars(erl_pp:function(Func)),
  375: 	    io:nl(),
  376: 	    io:put_chars("The body should be: erlang:nif_error(undef)"),
  377: 	    ct:fail(invalid_body)
  378:     end.
  379: 
  380: list_to_utf8_atom(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  381:     'hello' = atom_roundtrip("hello"),
  382:     'こんにちは' = atom_roundtrip("こんにちは"),
  383: 
  384:     %% Test all edge cases.
  385:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#80]),
  386:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#7F]),
  387:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#FF]),
  388:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#100]),
  389:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#7FF]),
  390:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#800]),
  391:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#D7FF]),
  392:     atom_badarg([16#D800]),
  393:     atom_badarg([16#DFFF]),
  394:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#E000]),
  395:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#FFFF]),
  396:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#1000]),
  397:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#10FFFF]),
  398:     atom_badarg([16#110000]),
  399: 
  400:     atom_badarg([-1]),
  401:     [atom_badarg([(-1 bsl N) + $A]) || N <- lists:seq(8,16)],
  402:     ok.
  403: 
  404: atom_roundtrip(String) ->
  405:     Atom = list_to_atom(String),
  406:     Atom = list_to_existing_atom(String),
  407:     String = atom_to_list(Atom),
  408:     Atom.
  409: 
  410: atom_badarg(String) ->
  411:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch list_to_atom(String)),
  412:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch list_to_existing_atom(String)),
  413:     ok.
  414: 
  415: t_list_to_existing_atom(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  416:     all = list_to_existing_atom("all"),
  417:     ?MODULE = list_to_existing_atom(?MODULE_STRING),
  418:     UnlikelyStr = "dsfj923874390867er869fds9864y97jhg3973qerueoru",
  419:     try
  420: 	list_to_existing_atom(UnlikelyStr),
  421: 	ct:fail(atom_exists)
  422:     catch
  423: 	error:badarg -> ok
  424:     end,
  425: 
  426:     %% The compiler has become smarter! We need the call to id/1 in
  427:     %% the next line.
  428:     UnlikelyAtom = list_to_atom(id(UnlikelyStr)),
  429:     UnlikelyAtom = list_to_existing_atom(UnlikelyStr),
  430:     ok.
  431: 
  432: os_env(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  433:     EnvVar1 = "MjhgvFDrresdCghN mnjkUYg vfrD",
  434:     false = os:getenv(EnvVar1),
  435:     true = os:putenv(EnvVar1, "mors"),
  436:     "mors" = os:getenv(EnvVar1),
  437:     true = os:putenv(EnvVar1, ""),
  438:     case os:getenv(EnvVar1) of
  439: 	      "" -> ok;
  440: 	      false -> ok;
  441: 	      BadVal -> ct:fail(BadVal)
  442: 	  end,
  443:     true = os:putenv(EnvVar1, "mors"),
  444:     true = os:unsetenv(EnvVar1),
  445:     false = os:getenv(EnvVar1),
  446:     true = os:unsetenv(EnvVar1), % unset unset variable
  447:     %% os:putenv, os:getenv and os:unsetenv currently use a temp
  448:     %% buffer of size 1024 for storing key+value
  449:     os_env_long(1010, 1030, "hej hopp").
  450:     
  451: os_env_long(Min, Max, _Value) when Min > Max ->
  452:     ok;
  453: os_env_long(Min, Max, Value) ->
  454:     EnvVar = lists:duplicate(Min, $X),
  455:     true = os:putenv(EnvVar, Value),
  456:     Value = os:getenv(EnvVar),
  457:     true = os:unsetenv(EnvVar),
  458:     os_env_long(Min+1, Max, Value).
  459: 
  460: os_env_case_sensitivity(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  461:     %% The keys in os:getenv/putenv must be case-insensitive on Windows, and
  462:     %% case-sensitive elsewhere.
  463:     true = os:putenv("os_env_gurka", "gaffel"),
  464:     Expected = case os:type() of
  465:                    {win32, _} -> "gaffel";
  466:                    _ -> false
  467:                end,
  468:     Expected = os:getenv("OS_ENV_GURKA"),
  469:     ok.
  470: 
  471: %% Test that string:to_integer does not Halloc in wrong order.
  472: otp_7526(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  473:     ok = test_7526(256).
  474: 
  475: iterate_7526(0, Acc) -> Acc;
  476: iterate_7526(N, Acc) ->
  477:     iterate_7526(N - 1,
  478: 		 [case string:to_integer("9223372036854775808,\n") of
  479: 		      {Int, _Foo} -> Int
  480: 		  end | Acc]).
  481: 
  482: do_test_7526(N,M) ->
  483:     {Self, Ref} = {self(), make_ref()},
  484:     T = erlang:make_tuple(M,0),
  485:     spawn_opt(fun()->
  486:                       L = iterate_7526(N, []),
  487:                       BadList = [X || X <- L, X =/= 9223372036854775808],
  488:                       BadLen = length(BadList),
  489:                       M = length(tuple_to_list(T)),
  490:                       %%io:format("~b bad conversions: ~p~n", [BadLen, BadList]),
  491:                       Self ! {done, Ref, BadLen}
  492:               end,
  493:               [link,{fullsweep_after,0}]),
  494:     receive {done, Ref, Len} -> Len end.
  495: 
  496: 
  497: test_7526(0) ->
  498:     ok;
  499: test_7526(N) ->
  500:     case do_test_7526(1000,N) of
  501: 	0 -> test_7526(N-1);
  502: 	Other ->
  503: 	    {error,N,Other}
  504:     end.
  505: 
  506: -define(BADARG(E), {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch E)).
  507: -define(SYS_LIMIT(E), {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = (catch E)).
  508: 
  509: t_binary_to_atom(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  510:     HalfLong = lists:seq(0, 127),
  511:     HalfLongAtom = list_to_atom(HalfLong),
  512:     HalfLongBin = list_to_binary(HalfLong),
  513:     Long = lists:seq(0, 254),
  514:     LongAtom = list_to_atom(Long),
  515:     LongBin = list_to_binary(Long),
  516:     UnicodeLongAtom = list_to_atom([$é || _ <- lists:seq(0, 254)]),
  517:     UnicodeLongBin = << <<"é"/utf8>> || _ <- lists:seq(0, 254)>>,
  518: 
  519:     %% latin1
  520:     '' = test_binary_to_atom(<<>>, latin1),
  521:     '\377' = test_binary_to_atom(<<255>>, latin1),
  522:     HalfLongAtom = test_binary_to_atom(HalfLongBin, latin1),
  523:     LongAtom = test_binary_to_atom(LongBin, latin1),
  524: 
  525:     %% utf8
  526:     '' = test_binary_to_atom(<<>>, utf8),
  527:     HalfLongAtom = test_binary_to_atom(HalfLongBin, utf8),
  528:     HalfLongAtom = test_binary_to_atom(HalfLongBin, unicode),
  529:     UnicodeLongAtom = test_binary_to_atom(UnicodeLongBin, utf8),
  530:     UnicodeLongAtom = test_binary_to_atom(UnicodeLongBin, unicode),
  531:     [] = [C || C <- lists:seq(128, 255),
  532: 		     begin
  533: 			 list_to_atom([C]) =/=
  534: 			     test_binary_to_atom(<<C/utf8>>, utf8)
  535: 		     end],
  536: 
  537:     ExoticBin = <<"こんにちは"/utf8>>,
  538:     ExoticAtom = test_binary_to_atom(ExoticBin, utf8),
  539:     ExoticBin = atom_to_binary(ExoticAtom, utf8),
  540:     ExoticBin = atom_to_binary(ExoticAtom),
  541: 
  542:     %% badarg failures.
  543:     fail_binary_to_atom(atom),
  544:     fail_binary_to_atom(42),
  545:     fail_binary_to_atom({a,b,c}),
  546:     fail_binary_to_atom([1,2,3]),
  547:     fail_binary_to_atom([]),
  548:     fail_binary_to_atom(42.0),
  549:     fail_binary_to_atom(self()),
  550:     fail_binary_to_atom(make_ref()),
  551:     fail_binary_to_atom(<<0:7>>),
  552:     fail_binary_to_atom(<<42:13>>),
  553:     ?BADARG(binary_to_atom(id(<<>>), blurf)),
  554:     ?BADARG(binary_to_atom(id(<<>>), [])),
  555: 
  556:     %% Bad UTF8 sequences.
  557:     ?BADARG(binary_to_atom(id(<<255>>), utf8)),
  558:     ?BADARG(binary_to_atom(id(<<255>>))),
  559:     ?BADARG(binary_to_atom(id(<<255,0>>), utf8)),
  560:     ?BADARG(binary_to_atom(id(<<16#C0,16#80>>), utf8)), %Overlong 0.
  561:     <<B:1/binary, _/binary>> = id(<<194, 163>>), %Truncated character ERL-474
  562:     ?BADARG(binary_to_atom(B, utf8)),
  563: 
  564:     %% system_limit failures.
  565:     ?SYS_LIMIT(binary_to_atom(id(<<0:512/unit:8,255>>), utf8)),
  566:     ?SYS_LIMIT(binary_to_atom(id(<<0:512/unit:8,255>>))),
  567:     ?SYS_LIMIT(binary_to_atom(id(<<0:512/unit:8,255,0>>), utf8)),
  568:     ?SYS_LIMIT(binary_to_atom(<<0:256/unit:8>>, latin1)),
  569:     ?SYS_LIMIT(binary_to_atom(<<0:257/unit:8>>, latin1)),
  570:     ?SYS_LIMIT(binary_to_atom(<<0:512/unit:8>>, latin1)),
  571:     ?SYS_LIMIT(binary_to_atom(<<0:256/unit:8>>, utf8)),
  572:     ?SYS_LIMIT(binary_to_atom(<<0:257/unit:8>>, utf8)),
  573:     ?SYS_LIMIT(binary_to_atom(<<0:512/unit:8>>, utf8)),
  574:     ok.
  575: 
  576: test_binary_to_atom(Bin0, Encoding) ->
  577:     Res = binary_to_atom(Bin0, Encoding),
  578:     Res = binary_to_existing_atom(Bin0, Encoding),
  579:     if
  580:         Encoding =:= utf8;
  581:         Encoding =:= unicode ->
  582:             Res = binary_to_atom(Bin0),
  583:             Res = binary_to_existing_atom(Bin0);
  584:        true ->
  585:             ok
  586:     end,
  587:     Bin1 = id(<<7:3,Bin0/binary,32:5>>),
  588:     Sz = byte_size(Bin0),
  589:     <<_:3,UnalignedBin:Sz/binary,_:5>> = Bin1,
  590:     Res = binary_to_atom(UnalignedBin, Encoding).
  591: 
  592: fail_binary_to_atom(Bin) ->
  593:     try
  594:         binary_to_atom(Bin, latin1)
  595:     catch
  596:         error:badarg ->
  597:             ok
  598:     end,
  599:     try
  600:         binary_to_atom(Bin, utf8)
  601:     catch
  602:         error:badarg ->
  603:             ok
  604:     end,
  605:     try
  606:         binary_to_atom(Bin)
  607:     catch
  608:         error:badarg ->
  609:             ok
  610:     end,
  611:     try
  612:         binary_to_existing_atom(Bin, latin1)
  613:     catch
  614:         error:badarg ->
  615:             ok
  616:     end,
  617:     try
  618:         binary_to_existing_atom(Bin, utf8)
  619:     catch
  620:         error:badarg ->
  621:             ok
  622:     end,
  623:     try
  624:         binary_to_existing_atom(Bin)
  625:     catch
  626:         error:badarg ->
  627:             ok
  628:     end.
  629: 	
  630: 
  631: t_binary_to_existing_atom(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  632:     UnlikelyBin = <<"ou0897979655678dsfj923874390867er869fds973qerueoru">>,
  633:     try
  634: 	binary_to_existing_atom(UnlikelyBin, latin1),
  635: 	ct:fail(atom_exists)
  636:     catch
  637: 	error:badarg -> ok
  638:     end,
  639: 
  640:     try
  641: 	binary_to_existing_atom(UnlikelyBin, utf8),
  642: 	ct:fail(atom_exists)
  643:     catch
  644: 	error:badarg -> ok
  645:     end,
  646:     try
  647: 	binary_to_existing_atom(UnlikelyBin),
  648: 	ct:fail(atom_exists)
  649:     catch
  650: 	error:badarg -> ok
  651:     end,
  652: 
  653:     UnlikelyAtom = binary_to_atom(id(UnlikelyBin), latin1),
  654:     UnlikelyAtom = binary_to_existing_atom(UnlikelyBin, latin1),
  655: 
  656:     %% ERL-944; a binary that was too large would overflow the latin1-to-utf8
  657:     %% conversion buffer.
  658:     OverflowAtom = <<0:511/unit:8,
  659:                      196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133,
  660:                      196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133,
  661:                      196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133,
  662:                      196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133>>,
  663:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch binary_to_existing_atom(OverflowAtom, latin1)),
  664: 
  665:     ok.
  666: 
  667: 
  668: t_atom_to_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  669:     HalfLong = lists:seq(0, 127),
  670:     HalfLongAtom = list_to_atom(HalfLong),
  671:     HalfLongBin = list_to_binary(HalfLong),
  672:     Long = lists:seq(0, 254),
  673:     LongAtom = list_to_atom(Long),
  674:     LongBin = list_to_binary(Long),
  675: 
  676:     %% latin1
  677:     <<>> = atom_to_binary('', latin1),
  678:     <<"abc">> = atom_to_binary(abc, latin1),
  679:     <<127>> = atom_to_binary('\177', latin1),
  680:     HalfLongBin = atom_to_binary(HalfLongAtom, latin1),
  681:     LongBin = atom_to_binary(LongAtom, latin1),
  682: 
  683:     %% utf8.
  684:     <<>> = atom_to_binary(''),
  685:     <<>> = atom_to_binary('', utf8),
  686:     <<>> = atom_to_binary('', unicode),
  687:     <<127>> = atom_to_binary('\177', utf8),
  688:     <<"abcdef">> = atom_to_binary(abcdef, utf8),
  689:     HalfLongBin = atom_to_binary(HalfLongAtom, utf8),
  690:     HalfLongBin = atom_to_binary(HalfLongAtom),
  691:     LongAtomBin = atom_to_binary(LongAtom, utf8),
  692:     LongAtomBin = atom_to_binary(LongAtom),
  693:     verify_long_atom_bin(LongAtomBin, 0),
  694: 
  695:     %% Failing cases.
  696:     fail_atom_to_binary(<<1>>),
  697:     fail_atom_to_binary(42),
  698:     fail_atom_to_binary({a,b,c}),
  699:     fail_atom_to_binary([1,2,3]),
  700:     fail_atom_to_binary([]),
  701:     fail_atom_to_binary(42.0),
  702:     fail_atom_to_binary(self()),
  703:     fail_atom_to_binary(make_ref()),
  704:     ?BADARG(atom_to_binary(id(a), blurf)),
  705:     ?BADARG(atom_to_binary(id(b), [])),
  706:     ok.
  707: 
  708: verify_long_atom_bin(<<I/utf8,T/binary>>, I) ->
  709:     verify_long_atom_bin(T, I+1);
  710: verify_long_atom_bin(<<>>, 255) -> ok.
  711: 
  712: fail_atom_to_binary(Term) ->
  713:     try
  714:         atom_to_binary(Term, latin1)
  715:     catch
  716:         error:badarg ->
  717:             ok
  718:     end,
  719:     try
  720:         atom_to_binary(Term, utf8)
  721:     catch
  722:         error:badarg ->
  723:             ok
  724:     end,
  725:     try
  726:         atom_to_binary(Term)
  727:     catch
  728:         error:badarg ->
  729:             ok
  730:     end.
  731: 
  732: 
  733: min_max(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  734:     Self = self(),
  735:     Port = hd(erlang:ports()),
  736:     Ref = make_ref(),
  737:     a = min(id(a), a),
  738:     a = min(id(a), b),
  739:     a = min(id(b), a),
  740:     b = min(id(b), b),
  741:     Ref = min(id(Self), id(Ref)),
  742: 
  743:     -3 = min(id(5), -3),
  744:     -3 = min(-3, id(5)),
  745:     -3 = min(0, id(-3)),
  746:     -3 = min(id(-3), 0),
  747:     0 = min(0, id(17)),
  748: 
  749:     a = max(id(a), a),
  750:     b = max(id(a), b),
  751:     b = max(id(b), a),
  752:     b = max(id(b), b),
  753:     Self = max(id(Self), id(Ref)),
  754: 
  755:     5 = max(id(5), -3),
  756:     5 = max(-3, id(5)),
  757:     0 = max(0, id(-3)),
  758:     0 = max(id(-3), 0),
  759:     17 = max(0, id(17)),
  760: 
  761:     %% Return the first argument when arguments are equal.
  762:     42.0 = min(id(42.0), 42),
  763:     42.0 = max(id(42.0), 42),
  764: 
  765:     Min = id(min),
  766:     Max = id(max),
  767: 
  768:     "abc" = erlang:Min("abc", "def"),
  769:     <<"def">> = erlang:Max(<<"abc">>, <<"def">>),
  770: 
  771:     %% Make sure that the JIT doesn't do any unsafe optimizations.
  772:     {0, 0} = min_max_zero(0),
  773:     {-7, 0} = min_max_zero(-7),
  774:     {0, 555} = min_max_zero(555),
  775:     {0, 1 bsl 64} = min_max_zero(1 bsl 64),
  776:     {-1 bsl 64, 0} = min_max_zero(-1 bsl 64),
  777: 
  778:     {-99, 23} = do_min_max(-99, 23),
  779:     {-10, 0} = do_min_max(0, -10),
  780:     {0, 77} = do_min_max(77, 0),
  781:     {1, 2} = do_min_max(1, 2),
  782:     {42, 99} = do_min_max(99, 42),
  783:     {100, 1 bsl 64} = do_min_max(100, 1 bsl 64),
  784:     {-1 bsl 64, 77} = do_min_max(77, -1 bsl 64),
  785:     {-1 bsl 64, 1 bsl 64} = do_min_max(1 bsl 64, -1 bsl 64),
  786:     {42.0, 43} = do_min_max(42.0, 43),
  787:     {42.0, 50.0} = do_min_max(42.0, 50.0),
  788:     {42.0, 42.0} = do_min_max(42.0, id(40.0 + 2.0)),
  789:     {{1,2}, {a,b}} = do_min_max({id(a), id(b)}, {id(1), id(2)}),
  790:     {{a,b}, [a,b]} = do_min_max({a,id(b)}, [a,id(b)]),
  791:     {{1.0,b}, {1.0,b}} = do_min_max({id(1.0), id(b)}, {id(1), id(b)}),
  792:     {{7,b}, {7,b}} = do_min_max({id(7), id(b)}, {id(7.0), id(b)}),
  793: 
  794:     {42,Self} = do_min_max(42, Self),
  795:     {42,Self} = do_min_max(Self, 42),
  796:     {42,Port} = do_min_max(42, Port),
  797:     {42,Port} = do_min_max(Port, 42),
  798: 
  799:     ok.
  800: 
  801: min_max_zero(A0) ->
  802:     Result = {min(A0, 0), max(A0, 0)},
  803:     Result = {min(0, A0), max(0, A0)},
  804:     A = id(A0),
  805:     Result = {min(A, 0), max(A, 0)},
  806:     Result = {min(0, A), max(0, A)}.
  807: 
  808: do_min_max(A0, B0) ->
  809:     Result = {min(A0, B0), max(A0, B0)},
  810: 
  811:     A0 = min(id(A0), A0),
  812:     A0 = max(id(A0), A0),
  813:     B0 = min(id(B0), B0),
  814:     B0 = max(id(B0), B0),
  815: 
  816:     A = id(A0),
  817:     B = id(B0),
  818:     Result = {min(A, B), max(A, B)},
  819: 
  820:     if
  821:         is_integer(A), is_atom(node(B)) orelse is_integer(B) ->
  822:             _ = id(0),
  823:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)};
  824:         is_atom(node(A)) orelse is_integer(A), is_integer(B) ->
  825:             _ = id(0),
  826:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)};
  827:         true ->
  828:             ok
  829:     end,
  830: 
  831:     if
  832:         is_integer(A), 0 =< A, A =< 1000, is_atom(node(B)) orelse is_integer(B) ->
  833:             _ = id(0),
  834:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)};
  835:         is_atom(node(A)) orelse is_integer(A), is_integer(B), 0 =< B, B =< 1000 ->
  836:             _ = id(0),
  837:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)};
  838:         true ->
  839:             ok
  840:     end,
  841: 
  842:     Result = do_min_max_1(1, 2, 3, 4, 5, A, B).
  843: 
  844: do_min_max_1(_, _, _, _, _, A, B) ->
  845:     if
  846:         is_integer(A), 0 =< A, A < 16#1_0000,
  847:         is_integer(B), 0 =< B, B < 16#1_0000 ->
  848:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)},
  849:             Result = {min(B, A),max(B, A)},
  850:             _ = id(0),
  851:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)},
  852:             Result = {min(B, A),max(B, A)};
  853:         is_integer(A), is_integer(B) ->
  854:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)},
  855:             Result = {min(B, A),max(B, A)},
  856:             _ = id(0),
  857:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)},
  858:             Result = {min(B, A),max(B, A)};
  859:         is_float(A), is_float(B) ->
  860:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)},
  861:             Result = {min(B, A),max(B, A)},
  862:             _ = id(0),
  863:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)},
  864:             Result = {min(B, A),max(B, A)};
  865:         is_number(A), is_number(B) ->
  866:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)},
  867:             _ = id(0),
  868:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)};
  869:         true ->
  870:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)},
  871:             _ = id(0),
  872:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)}
  873:     end.
  874: 
  875: erlang_halt(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  876:     try erlang:halt(undefined) of
  877: 	_-> ct:fail({erlang,halt,{undefined}})
  878:     catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  879:     try halt(undefined) of
  880: 	_-> ct:fail({halt,{undefined}})
  881:     catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  882:     try erlang:halt(undefined, []) of
  883: 	_-> ct:fail({erlang,halt,{undefined,[]}})
  884:     catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  885:     try halt(undefined, []) of
  886: 	_-> ct:fail({halt,{undefined,[]}})
  887:     catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  888:     try halt(0, undefined) of
  889: 	_-> ct:fail({halt,{0,undefined}})
  890:     catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  891:     try halt(0, [undefined]) of
  892: 	_-> ct:fail({halt,{0,[undefined]}})
  893:     catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  894:     try halt(0, [{undefined,true}]) of
  895: 	_-> ct:fail({halt,{0,[{undefined,true}]}})
  896:     catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  897:     try halt(0, [{flush,undefined}]) of
  898: 	_-> ct:fail({halt,{0,[{flush,undefined}]}})
  899:     catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  900:     try halt(0, [{flush,true,undefined}]) of
  901: 	_-> ct:fail({halt,{0,[{flush,true,undefined}]}})
  902:     catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  903:     {ok, _, N1} = ?CT_PEER(),
  904:     {badrpc,nodedown} = rpc:call(N1, erlang, halt, []),
  905:     {ok, _, N2} = ?CT_PEER(),
  906:     {badrpc,nodedown} = rpc:call(N2, erlang, halt, [0]),
  907:     {ok, _, N3} = ?CT_PEER(),
  908:     {badrpc,nodedown} = rpc:call(N3, erlang, halt, [0,[]]),
  909:     {ok, _, N4} = ?CT_PEER(),
  910:     {badrpc,nodedown} = rpc:call(N4, erlang, halt, [lists:duplicate(300,$x)]),
  911:     %% Test unicode slogan
  912:     {ok, _, N5} = ?CT_PEER(),
  913:     {badrpc,nodedown} = rpc:call(N5, erlang, halt, [[339,338,254,230,198,295,167,223,32,12507,12531,12480]]),
  914: 
  915:     % This test triggers a segfault when dumping a crash dump
  916:     % to make sure that we can handle it properly.
  917: 
  918:     %% Prevent address sanitizer from catching SEGV in slave node
  919:     AsanOpts = add_asan_opt("handle_segv=0"),
  920:     {ok, _, N6} = ?CT_PEER(),
  921:     reset_asan_opts(AsanOpts),
  922: 
  923:     CrashDump = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  924:                               "segfault_erl_crash.dump"),
  925:     true = rpc:call(N6, os, putenv, ["ERL_CRASH_DUMP",CrashDump]),
  926:     false = rpc:call(N6, erts_debug, set_internal_state,
  927:                      [available_internal_state, true]),
  928:     {badrpc,nodedown} = rpc:call(N6, erts_debug, set_internal_state,
  929:                                  [broken_halt, "Validate correct crash dump"]),
  930:     {ok,_} = wait_until_stable_size(CrashDump,-1),
  931:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(CrashDump),
  932:     case {string:find(Bin, <<"\n=end\n">>),
  933:           string:find(Bin, <<"\r\n=end\r\n">>)} of
  934:         {nomatch,nomatch} ->
  935:             ct:fail("Could not find end marker in crash dump");
  936:         {_,_} ->
  937:             ok
  938:     end.
  939: 
  940: add_asan_opt(Opt) ->
  941:     case test_server:is_asan() of
  942: 	true ->
  943: 	    case os:getenv("ASAN_OPTIONS") of
  944: 		false ->
  945: 		    os:putenv("ASAN_OPTIONS", Opt),
  946: 		    undefined;
  947: 		AO ->
  948: 		    os:putenv("ASAN_OPTIONS", AO ++ [$: | Opt]),
  949: 		    AO
  950: 	    end;
  951: 	_ ->
  952: 	    false
  953:     end.
  954: 
  955: reset_asan_opts(false) -> ok;
  956: reset_asan_opts(undefined) -> os:unsetenv("ASAN_OPTIONS");
  957: reset_asan_opts(AO) -> os:putenv("ASAN_OPTIONS", AO).
  958: 
  959: wait_until_stable_size(_File,-10) ->
  960:     {error,enoent};
  961: wait_until_stable_size(File,PrevSz) ->
  962:     timer:sleep(250),
  963:     case file:read_file_info(File) of
  964:         {error,enoent} ->
  965:             wait_until_stable_size(File,PrevSz-1);
  966:         {ok,#file_info{size = PrevSz }} when PrevSz /= -1 ->
  967:             io:format("Crashdump file size was: ~p (~s)~n",[PrevSz,File]),
  968:             {ok,PrevSz};
  969:         {ok,#file_info{size = NewSz }} ->
  970:             wait_until_stable_size(File,NewSz)
  971:     end.
  972: 
  973: % Test erlang:halt with ERL_CRASH_DUMP_BYTES
  974: erl_crash_dump_bytes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  975:     Bytes = 1000,
  976:     CrashDump = do_limited_crash_dump(Config, Bytes),
  977:     {ok,ActualBytes} = wait_until_stable_size(CrashDump,-1),
  978:     true = ActualBytes < (Bytes + 100),
  979: 
  980:     NoDump = do_limited_crash_dump(Config,0),
  981:     {error,enoent} = wait_until_stable_size(NoDump,-8),
  982:     ok.
  983: 
  984: do_limited_crash_dump(Config, Bytes) ->
  985:     {ok, _, N} = ?CT_PEER(),
  986:     BytesStr = integer_to_list(Bytes),
  987:     CrashDump = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  988:                               "erl_crash." ++ BytesStr ++ ".dump"),
  989:     true = rpc:call(N, os, putenv, ["ERL_CRASH_DUMP",CrashDump]),
  990:     true = rpc:call(N, os, putenv, ["ERL_CRASH_DUMP_BYTES",BytesStr]),
  991:     {badrpc,nodedown} = rpc:call(N, erlang, halt, ["Testing ERL_CRASH_DUMP_BYTES"]),
  992:     CrashDump.
  993: 
  994: 
  995: is_builtin(_Config) ->
  996:     Exp0 = [{M,F,A} || {M,_} <- code:all_loaded(),
  997: 		       {F,A} <- M:module_info(exports)],
  998:     Exp = ordsets:from_list(Exp0),
  999: 
 1000:     %% Built-ins implemented as special instructions.
 1001:     Instructions = [{erlang,apply,2},{erlang,apply,3},{erlang,yield,0}],
 1002: 
 1003:     Builtins0 = Instructions ++ erlang:system_info(snifs),
 1004:     Builtins = ordsets:from_list(Builtins0),
 1005: 
 1006:     Fakes = [{M,F,42} || {M,F,_} <- Instructions],
 1007:     All = ordsets:from_list(Fakes ++ Exp),
 1008:     NotBuiltin = ordsets:subtract(All, Builtins),
 1009: 
 1010:     _ = [{true,_} = {erlang:is_builtin(M, F, A),MFA} ||
 1011:             {M,F,A}=MFA <- Builtins],
 1012:     _ = [{false,_} = {erlang:is_builtin(M, F, A),MFA} ||
 1013:             {M,F,A}=MFA <- NotBuiltin],
 1014: 
 1015:     ok.
 1016: 
 1017: error_stacktrace(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1018:     error_stacktrace_test().
 1019: 
 1020: error_stacktrace_during_call_trace(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1021:     Tracer = spawn_link(fun () ->
 1022: 				receive after infinity -> ok end
 1023: 			end),
 1024:     Mprog = [{'_',[],[{exception_trace}]}],
 1025:     erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE,'_','_'}, Mprog, [local]),
 1026:     1 = erlang:trace_pattern({erlang,error,2}, Mprog, [local]),
 1027:     1 = erlang:trace_pattern({erlang,error,1}, Mprog, [local]),
 1028:     erlang:trace(all, true, [call,return_to,timestamp,{tracer, Tracer}]),
 1029:     try
 1030: 	error_stacktrace_test()
 1031:     after
 1032: 	erlang:trace(all, false, [call,return_to,timestamp,{tracer, Tracer}]),
 1033: 	erlang:trace_pattern({erlang,error,2}, false, [local]),
 1034: 	erlang:trace_pattern({erlang,error,1}, false, [local]),
 1035: 	erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE,'_','_'}, false, [local]),
 1036: 	unlink(Tracer),
 1037: 	exit(Tracer, kill),
 1038: 	Mon = erlang:monitor(process, Tracer),
 1039: 	receive
 1040: 	    {'DOWN', Mon, process, Tracer, _} -> ok
 1041: 	end
 1042:     end,
 1043:     ok.
 1044: 
 1045: error_stacktrace_test() ->
 1046:     Types = [apply_const_last, apply_const, apply_last,
 1047: 	     apply, double_apply_const_last, double_apply_const,
 1048: 	     double_apply_last, double_apply, multi_apply_const_last,
 1049:              apply_const_only, apply_only,
 1050: 	     multi_apply_const, multi_apply_last, multi_apply,
 1051: 	     call_const_last, call_last, call_const, call],
 1052:     lists:foreach(fun (Type) ->
 1053: 			  {Pid, Mon} = spawn_monitor(
 1054: 					 fun () ->
 1055: 						 stk([a,b,c,d], Type, error_2)
 1056: 					 end),
 1057: 			  receive
 1058: 			      {'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, Reason} ->
 1059: 				  {oops, Stack} = Reason,
 1060: %%				  io:format("Type: ~p Stack: ~p~n",
 1061: %%					    [Type, Stack]),
 1062: 				  [{?MODULE, do_error_2, [Type], _},
 1063: 				   {?MODULE, stk, 3, _},
 1064: 				   {?MODULE, stk, 3, _}] = Stack
 1065: 			  end
 1066: 		  end,
 1067: 		  Types),
 1068:     lists:foreach(fun (Type) ->
 1069: 			  {Pid, Mon} = spawn_monitor(
 1070: 					 fun () ->
 1071: 						 stk([a,b,c,d], Type, error_1)
 1072: 					 end),
 1073: 			  receive
 1074: 			      {'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, Reason} ->
 1075: 				  {oops, Stack} = Reason,
 1076: %%				  io:format("Type: ~p Stack: ~p~n",
 1077: %%					    [Type, Stack]),
 1078: 				  [{?MODULE, do_error_1, 1, _},
 1079: 				   {?MODULE, stk, 3, _},
 1080: 				   {?MODULE, stk, 3, _}] = Stack
 1081: 			  end
 1082: 		  end,
 1083: 		  Types),
 1084:     ok.
 1085: 
 1086: stk([_|L], Type, Func) ->
 1087:     stk(L, Type, Func),
 1088:     %% Force the compiler to keep this body-recursive. We want the stack trace
 1089:     %% to have one entry here and another in the base case to test that
 1090:     %% multiple frames in the same function aren't removed unless they're
 1091:     %% identical.
 1092:     id(ok);
 1093: stk([], Type, Func) ->
 1094:     put(erlang, erlang),
 1095:     put(tail, []),
 1096:     tail(Type, Func, jump),
 1097:     id(ok).
 1098: 
 1099: tail(Type, Func, jump) ->
 1100:     tail(Type, Func, do);
 1101: tail(Type, error_1, do) ->
 1102:     do_error_1(Type);
 1103: tail(Type, error_2, do) ->
 1104:     do_error_2(Type).
 1105: 
 1106: do_error_2(apply_const_only) ->
 1107:     apply(erlang, error, [oops, [apply_const_only]]);
 1108: do_error_2(apply_only) ->
 1109:     Erlang = get(erlang),
 1110:     Tail = get(tail),
 1111:     apply(Erlang, error, [oops, [apply_only|Tail]]);
 1112: do_error_2(apply_const_last) ->
 1113:     erlang:apply(erlang, error, [oops, [apply_const_last]]);
 1114: do_error_2(apply_const) ->
 1115:     erlang:apply(erlang, error, [oops, [apply_const]]),
 1116:     ok;
 1117: do_error_2(apply_last) ->
 1118:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(error), id([oops, [apply_last]]));
 1119: do_error_2(apply) ->
 1120:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(error), id([oops, [apply]])),
 1121:     ok;
 1122: do_error_2(double_apply_const_last) ->
 1123:     erlang:apply(erlang, apply, [erlang, error, [oops, [double_apply_const_last]]]);
 1124: do_error_2(double_apply_const) ->
 1125:     erlang:apply(erlang, apply, [erlang, error, [oops, [double_apply_const]]]),
 1126:     ok;
 1127: do_error_2(double_apply_last) ->
 1128:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(error), id([oops, [double_apply_last]])]);
 1129: do_error_2(double_apply) ->
 1130:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(error), id([oops, [double_apply]])]),
 1131:     ok;
 1132: do_error_2(multi_apply_const_last) ->
 1133:     erlang:apply(erlang, apply, [erlang, apply, [erlang, apply, [erlang, error, [oops, [multi_apply_const_last]]]]]);
 1134: do_error_2(multi_apply_const) ->
 1135:     erlang:apply(erlang, apply, [erlang, apply, [erlang, apply, [erlang, error, [oops, [multi_apply_const]]]]]),
 1136:     ok;
 1137: do_error_2(multi_apply_last) ->
 1138:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(error), id([oops, [multi_apply_last]])]]]);
 1139: do_error_2(multi_apply) ->
 1140:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(error), id([oops, [multi_apply]])]]]),
 1141:     ok;
 1142: do_error_2(call_const_last) ->
 1143:     erlang:error(oops, [call_const_last]);
 1144: do_error_2(call_last) ->
 1145:     erlang:error(id(oops), id([call_last]));
 1146: do_error_2(call_const) ->
 1147:     erlang:error(oops, [call_const]),
 1148:     ok;
 1149: do_error_2(call) ->
 1150:     erlang:error(id(oops), id([call])).
 1151: 
 1152: 
 1153: do_error_1(apply_const_only) ->
 1154:     apply(erlang, error, [oops]);
 1155: do_error_1(apply_only) ->
 1156:     Erlang = get(erlang),
 1157:     Tail = get(tail),
 1158:     apply(Erlang, error, [oops|Tail]);
 1159: do_error_1(apply_const_last) ->
 1160:     erlang:apply(erlang, error, [oops]);
 1161: do_error_1(apply_const) ->
 1162:     erlang:apply(erlang, error, [oops]),
 1163:     ok;
 1164: do_error_1(apply_last) ->
 1165:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(error), id([oops]));
 1166: do_error_1(apply) ->
 1167:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(error), id([oops])),
 1168:     ok;
 1169: do_error_1(double_apply_const_last) ->
 1170:     erlang:apply(erlang, apply, [erlang, error, [oops]]);
 1171: do_error_1(double_apply_const) ->
 1172:     erlang:apply(erlang, apply, [erlang, error, [oops]]),
 1173:     ok;
 1174: do_error_1(double_apply_last) ->
 1175:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(error), id([oops])]);
 1176: do_error_1(double_apply) ->
 1177:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(error), id([oops])]),
 1178:     ok;
 1179: do_error_1(multi_apply_const_last) ->
 1180:     erlang:apply(erlang, apply, [erlang, apply, [erlang, apply, [erlang, error, [oops]]]]);
 1181: do_error_1(multi_apply_const) ->
 1182:     erlang:apply(erlang, apply, [erlang, apply, [erlang, apply, [erlang, error, [oops]]]]),
 1183:     ok;
 1184: do_error_1(multi_apply_last) ->
 1185:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(error), id([oops])]]]);
 1186: do_error_1(multi_apply) ->
 1187:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(error), id([oops])]]]),
 1188:     ok;
 1189: do_error_1(call_const_last) ->
 1190:     erlang:error(oops);
 1191: do_error_1(call_last) ->
 1192:     erlang:error(id(oops));
 1193: do_error_1(call_const) ->
 1194:     erlang:error(oops),
 1195:     ok;
 1196: do_error_1(call) ->
 1197:     erlang:error(id(oops)).
 1198: 
 1199: 
 1200: group_leader_prio(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1201:     group_leader_prio_test(false).
 1202: 
 1203: group_leader_prio_dirty(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1204:     group_leader_prio_test(true).
 1205: 
 1206: group_leader_prio_test(Dirty) ->
 1207:     %%
 1208:     %% Unfortunately back in the days node local group_leader/2 was not
 1209:     %% implemented as sending an asynchronous signal to the process to change
 1210:     %% group leader for. Instead it has always been synchronously changed, and
 1211:     %% nothing in the documentation have hinted otherwise... Therefore I do not
 1212:     %% dare the change this.
 1213:     %%
 1214:     %% In order to prevent priority inversion, the priority of the receiver of
 1215:     %% the group leader signal is elevated while handling incoming signals if
 1216:     %% the sender has a higher priority than the receiver. This test tests that
 1217:     %% the priority elevation actually works...
 1218:     %%
 1219:     Tester = self(),
 1220:     Init = erlang:whereis(init),
 1221:     GL = erlang:group_leader(),
 1222:     process_flag(priority, max),
 1223:     {TestProcFun, NTestProcs}
 1224:         = case Dirty of
 1225:               false ->
 1226:                   %% These processes will handle all incoming signals
 1227:                   %% by them selves...
 1228:                   {fun () ->
 1229:                            Tester ! {alive, self()},
 1230:                            receive after infinity -> ok end
 1231:                    end,
 1232:                    100};
 1233:               true ->
 1234:                   %% These processes won't handle incoming signals by
 1235:                   %% them selves since they are stuck on dirty schedulers
 1236:                   %% when we try to change group leader. A dirty process
 1237:                   %% signal handler process (system process) will be notified
 1238:                   %% of the need to handle incoming signals for these processes,
 1239:                   %% and will instead handle the signal for these processes...
 1240:                   {fun () ->
 1241:                            %% The following sends the message '{alive, self()}'
 1242:                            %% to Tester once on a dirty io scheduler, then wait
 1243:                            %% there until the process terminates...
 1244:                            erts_debug:dirty_io(alive_waitexiting, Tester)
 1245:                    end,
 1246:                    erlang:system_info(dirty_io_schedulers)}
 1247:           end,
 1248:     TPs = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 1249:                             spawn_opt(TestProcFun,
 1250:                                       [link, {priority, normal}])
 1251:                     end, lists:seq(1, NTestProcs)),
 1252:     lists:foreach(fun (TP) -> receive {alive, TP} -> ok end end, TPs),
 1253:     TLs = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 1254:                             spawn_opt(fun () -> tok_loop() end,
 1255:                                       [link, {priority, high}])
 1256:                     end,
 1257:                     lists:seq(1, 2*erlang:system_info(schedulers))),
 1258:     %% Wait to ensure distribution of high prio processes over schedulers...
 1259:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 1260:     %%
 1261:     %% Test that we can get group-leader signals through to normal prio
 1262:     %% processes from a max prio process even though all schedulers are filled
 1263:     %% with executing high prio processes.
 1264:     %%
 1265:     lists:foreach(fun (_) ->
 1266:                           lists:foreach(fun (TP) ->
 1267:                                                 erlang:yield(),
 1268:                                                 %% whitebox -- Enqueue some signals on it
 1269:                                                 %% preventing us from hogging its main lock
 1270:                                                 %% and set group-leader directly....
 1271:                                                 erlang:demonitor(erlang:monitor(process, TP)),
 1272:                                                 true = erlang:group_leader(Init, TP),
 1273:                                                 {group_leader, Init} = process_info(TP, group_leader),
 1274:                                                 erlang:demonitor(erlang:monitor(process, TP)),
 1275:                                                 true = erlang:group_leader(GL, TP),
 1276:                                                 {group_leader, GL} = process_info(TP, group_leader)
 1277:                                         end,
 1278:                                         TPs)
 1279:                   end,
 1280:                   lists:seq(1,100)),
 1281:     %%
 1282:     %% Also test when it is exiting...
 1283:     %%
 1284:     lists:foreach(fun (TP) ->
 1285:                           erlang:yield(),
 1286:                           M = erlang:monitor(process, TP),
 1287:                           unlink(TP),
 1288:                           exit(TP, bang),
 1289:                           badarg = try
 1290:                                        true = erlang:group_leader(Init, TP)
 1291:                                    catch
 1292:                                        error : What -> What
 1293:                                    end,
 1294:                           receive
 1295:                               {'DOWN', M, process, TP, Reason} ->
 1296:                                   bang = Reason
 1297:                           end
 1298:                   end,
 1299:                   TPs),
 1300:     lists:foreach(fun (TL) ->
 1301:                           M = erlang:monitor(process, TL),
 1302:                           unlink(TL),
 1303:                           exit(TL, bang),
 1304:                           receive
 1305:                               {'DOWN', M, process, TL, Reason} ->
 1306:                                   bang = Reason
 1307:                           end
 1308:                   end,
 1309:                   TLs),
 1310:     ok.
 1311: 
 1312: is_process_alive(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1313:     process_flag(priority, max),
 1314:     Ps = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 1315:                            spawn_opt(fun () -> tok_loop() end,
 1316:                                      [{priority, high}, link])
 1317:                    end,
 1318:                    lists:seq(1, 2*erlang:system_info(schedulers))),
 1319:     receive after 1000 -> ok end, %% Wait for load to spread
 1320:     lists:foreach(fun (P) ->
 1321:                           %% Ensure that signal order is preserved
 1322:                           %% and that we are not starved due to
 1323:                           %% priority inversion
 1324:                           true = erlang:is_process_alive(P),
 1325:                           unlink(P),
 1326:                           true = erlang:is_process_alive(P),
 1327:                           exit(P, kill),
 1328:                           false = erlang:is_process_alive(P)
 1329:                   end,
 1330:                   Ps),
 1331:     ok.
 1332: 
 1333: is_process_alive_signal_from(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1334:     process_flag(priority, high),
 1335:     process_flag(scheduler, 1),
 1336:     Schdlr = case erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) of
 1337:                  1 -> 1;
 1338:                  _ -> 2
 1339:              end,
 1340:     X = is_process_alive_signal_from_test(100000, 0, Schdlr),
 1341:     erlang:display({exits_detected, X}),
 1342:     {comment, integer_to_list(X) ++ " exited processes detected"}.
 1343: 
 1344: is_process_alive_signal_from_test(0, X, _Schdlr) ->
 1345:     X;
 1346: is_process_alive_signal_from_test(N, X, Schdlr) ->
 1347:     Tester = self(),
 1348:     {Testee, TMon} = spawn_opt(fun () ->
 1349:                                        Mon = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 1350:                                        Tester ! {self(), ready},
 1351:                                        busy_wait_go(),
 1352:                                        _ = erlang:demonitor(Mon),
 1353:                                        exit(normal)
 1354:                                end,
 1355:                                [link,
 1356:                                 monitor,
 1357:                                 {priority, high},
 1358:                                 {scheduler, Schdlr}]),
 1359:     receive {Testee, ready} -> ok end,
 1360:     {monitored_by, MBList1} = process_info(self(), monitored_by),
 1361:     true = lists:member(Testee, MBList1),
 1362:     erlang:yield(),
 1363:     Testee ! {go, ok},
 1364:     erlang:yield(),
 1365:     NewX = case erlang:is_process_alive(Testee) of
 1366:                true ->
 1367:                    X;
 1368:                false ->
 1369:                    %% Demonitor signal should have reached us before the
 1370:                    %% is-process-alive reply...
 1371:                    {monitored_by, MBList2} = process_info(self(), monitored_by),
 1372:                    false = lists:member(Testee, MBList2),
 1373:                    X+1
 1374:            end,
 1375:     receive {'DOWN', TMon, process, Testee, normal} -> ok end,
 1376:     is_process_alive_signal_from_test(N-1, NewX, Schdlr).
 1377: 
 1378: process_info_blast(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1379:     Tester = self(),
 1380:     NoAttackers = 1000,
 1381:     NoAL = lists:seq(1, NoAttackers),
 1382:     Consume = make_ref(),
 1383:     Victim = spawn_link(fun () ->
 1384:                                 receive
 1385:                                     Consume ->
 1386:                                         ok
 1387:                                 end,
 1388:                                 consume_msgs()
 1389:                         end),
 1390:     AFun = fun () ->
 1391:                    Victim ! hej,
 1392:                    Res = process_info(Victim, message_queue_len),
 1393:                    Tester ! {self(), Res}
 1394:            end,
 1395:     Attackers0 = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 1396:                                    spawn_link(AFun)
 1397:                            end,
 1398:                            NoAL),
 1399:     lists:foreach(fun (A) ->
 1400:                           receive
 1401:                               {A, Res} ->
 1402:                                   case Res of
 1403:                                       {message_queue_len, Len} when Len > 0, Len =< NoAttackers ->
 1404:                                           Len;
 1405:                                       Error ->
 1406:                                           exit({unexpected, Error})
 1407:                                   end
 1408:                           end
 1409:                   end,
 1410:                   Attackers0),
 1411:     Attackers1 = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 1412:                                    spawn_link(AFun)
 1413:                            end,
 1414:                            NoAL),
 1415:     Victim ! Consume,
 1416:     lists:foreach(fun (A) ->
 1417:                           receive
 1418:                               {A, Res} ->
 1419:                                   case Res of
 1420:                                       {message_queue_len, Len} when Len >= 0, Len =< 2*NoAttackers+1 ->
 1421:                                           ok;
 1422:                                       undefined ->
 1423:                                           ok;
 1424:                                       Error ->
 1425:                                           exit({unexpected, Error})
 1426:                                   end
 1427:                           end
 1428:                   end,
 1429:                   Attackers1),
 1430:     KillFun = fun (P) ->
 1431:                       unlink(P),
 1432:                       exit(P, kill),
 1433:                       false = erlang:is_process_alive(P)
 1434:               end,
 1435:     lists:foreach(fun (A) -> KillFun(A) end, Attackers0),
 1436:     lists:foreach(fun (A) -> KillFun(A) end, Attackers1),
 1437:     KillFun(Victim),
 1438:     ok.
 1439: 
 1440: consume_msgs() ->
 1441:     receive
 1442:         _ ->
 1443:             consume_msgs()
 1444:     after 0 ->
 1445:               ok
 1446:     end.
 1447: 
 1448: 
 1449: %% Test that process_info(Pid, [message_queue_len]) works correctly when
 1450: %%  fetching part of the middle signal queue into inner queue.
 1451: verify_middle_queue_save(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1452:     Control = self(),
 1453:     ProcessToHang = spawn_link(
 1454:         fun () ->
 1455:             Single = self(),
 1456:             put(count, 0),
 1457:             Doubles = [spawn_link(fun () -> message_queue_len_retrievers(Single, 0) end) || _ <- lists:seq(1, 2)],
 1458:             Control ! {doubles, Doubles},
 1459:             process_that_hangs(Control, 0, Doubles)
 1460:         end),
 1461:     ensure_not_hanging(ProcessToHang, [], 50000).
 1462: 
 1463: process_that_hangs(Control, Total, Doubles) ->
 1464:     put(count, Total),
 1465:     %% fetch something innocent, like 'priority' of the process
 1466:     [process_info(Pid, [priority]) || Pid <- Doubles],
 1467:     Control ! alive,
 1468:     process_that_hangs(Control, Total + 1, Doubles).
 1469: 
 1470: message_queue_len_retrievers(Control, PrevCount) ->
 1471:     %% need to fetch dictionary for test reasons, but actual trigger is 'message_queue_len',
 1472:     %%  or 'memory', or 'total_heap_size' - anything that needs to fetch external message queue
 1473:     %%  via ERTS_PI_FLAG_NEED_MSGQ_LEN internal flag to process_info
 1474:     [_, {dictionary, [{count, Count}]}] = erlang:process_info(Control, [message_queue_len, dictionary]),
 1475:     Count > PrevCount andalso begin Control ! count end,
 1476:     message_queue_len_retrievers(Control, Count).
 1477: 
 1478: ensure_not_hanging(Proc, _Doubles, 0) ->
 1479:     unlink(Proc),
 1480:     exit(Proc, kill);
 1481: ensure_not_hanging(Proc, Doubles, Remaining) ->
 1482:     receive
 1483:         alive ->
 1484:             ensure_not_hanging(Proc, Doubles, Remaining - 1);
 1485:         {doubles, NewDoubles} ->
 1486:             ensure_not_hanging(Proc, NewDoubles, Remaining)
 1487:     after 1000 ->
 1488:         Reason = {Proc, "hung", erlang:process_info(Proc, backtrace)},
 1489:         unlink(Proc),
 1490:         exit(Proc, kill),
 1491:         ct:fail(Reason)
 1492:     end.
 1493: 
 1494: %% Test that length/1 returns the correct result after trapping, and
 1495: %% also that the argument is correct in the stacktrace for a badarg
 1496: %% exception.
 1497: 
 1498: test_length(_Config) ->
 1499:     {Start,Inc} = case test_server:timetrap_scale_factor() of
 1500:                       1 -> {16*4000,3977};
 1501:                       _ -> {100,1}
 1502:             end,
 1503:     Good = lists:reverse(lists:seq(1, Start)),
 1504:     Bad = Good ++ [bad|cons],
 1505:     test_length(Start, 10*Start, Inc, Good, Bad),
 1506: 
 1507:     %% Test that calling length/1 from a match spec works.
 1508:     MsList = lists:seq(1, 2*Start),
 1509:     MsInput = [{tag,Good},{tag,MsList}],
 1510:     Ms0 = [{{tag,'$1'},[{'>',{length,'$1'},Start}],['$1']}],
 1511:     Ms = ets:match_spec_compile(Ms0),
 1512:     [MsList] = ets:match_spec_run(MsInput, Ms),
 1513:     ok.
 1514: 
 1515: test_length(I, N, Inc, Good, Bad) when I < N ->
 1516:     Length = id(length),
 1517:     I = length(Good),
 1518:     I = erlang:Length(Good),
 1519: 
 1520:     %% Test length/1 in guards.
 1521:     if
 1522:         length(Good) =:= I ->
 1523:             ok
 1524:     end,
 1525:     if
 1526:         length(Bad) =:= I ->
 1527:             error(should_fail);
 1528:         true ->
 1529:             ok
 1530:     end,
 1531: 
 1532:     {'EXIT',{badarg,[{erlang,length,[[I|_]],_}|_]}} = (catch length(Bad)),
 1533:     {'EXIT',{badarg,[{erlang,length,[[I|_]],_}|_]}} = (catch erlang:Length(Bad)),
 1534:     IncSeq = lists:seq(I + 1, I + Inc),
 1535:     test_length(I+Inc, N, Inc,
 1536:                 lists:reverse(IncSeq, Good),
 1537:                 lists:reverse(IncSeq, Bad));
 1538: test_length(_, _, _, _, _) -> ok.
 1539: 
 1540: %% apply/3 with a fixed number of arguments didn't include all arguments on
 1541: %% badarg exceptions.
 1542: fixed_apply_badarg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1543:     Bad = id({}),
 1544: 
 1545:     {'EXIT',{badarg, [{erlang,apply,[{},baz,[a,b]],[{error_info,_}]} | _]}} =
 1546:         (catch Bad:baz(a,b)),
 1547:     {'EXIT',{badarg, [{erlang,apply,[baz,{},[c,d]],[{error_info,_}]} | _]}} =
 1548:         (catch baz:Bad(c,d)),
 1549: 
 1550:     {'EXIT',{badarg, [{erlang,apply,[{},baz,[e,f]],[{error_info,_}]} | _]}} =
 1551:         (catch apply(Bad,baz,[e,f])),
 1552:     {'EXIT',{badarg, [{erlang,apply,[baz,{},[g,h]],[{error_info,_}]} | _]}} =
 1553:         (catch apply(baz,Bad,[g,h])),
 1554: 
 1555:     ok.
 1556: 
 1557: external_fun_apply3(_Config) ->
 1558:     %% erlang:apply/3 would always badarg when called through an external fun.
 1559: 
 1560:     Apply = id(fun erlang:apply/3),
 1561:     Self = Apply(erlang, self, []),
 1562:     true = is_pid(Self),
 1563: 
 1564:     {'EXIT',{undef,_}} = (catch Apply(does, 'not', [exist])),
 1565: 
 1566:     ok.
 1567: 
 1568: node_1(_Config) ->
 1569:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1570: 
 1571:     local_node(self()),
 1572:     LocalPort = lists:last(erlang:ports()),
 1573:     local_node(LocalPort),
 1574:     local_node(make_ref()),
 1575: 
 1576:     external_node(erpc:call(Node, erlang, self, []), Node),
 1577:     ExtPort = hd(erpc:call(Node, erlang, ports, [])),
 1578:     external_node(ExtPort, Node),
 1579:     external_node(erpc:call(Node, erlang, make_ref, []), Node),
 1580: 
 1581:     node_error(a),
 1582:     node_error(42),
 1583:     node_error({a,b,c}),
 1584:     node_error({tag,self()}),
 1585:     node_error([self()]),
 1586:     node_error(1 bsl 133),
 1587:     node_error(#{}),
 1588:     node_error(#{id(a) => b}),
 1589:     node_error(<<"binary">>),
 1590: 
 1591:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1592:     ok.
 1593: 
 1594: local_node(E) ->
 1595:     test_node(E, node()).
 1596: 
 1597: external_node(E, Node) ->
 1598:     test_node(E, Node).
 1599: 
 1600: test_node(E0, Node) ->
 1601:     true = node(id(E0)) =:= Node,
 1602:     E = id(E0),
 1603:     if
 1604:         node(E) =:= Node ->
 1605:             ok
 1606:     end,
 1607:     test_node_2(id(E), Node).
 1608: 
 1609: test_node_2(E, Node) when is_pid(E); is_port(E); is_reference(E) ->
 1610:     true = node(E) =:= Node,
 1611:     if
 1612:         node(E) =:= Node ->
 1613:             ok
 1614:     end,
 1615:     test_node_3(id(E), Node),
 1616:     ok.
 1617: 
 1618: test_node_3(E, Node) when is_pid(E) ->
 1619:     true = node(E) =:= Node;
 1620: test_node_3(E, Node) when is_port(E) ->
 1621:     true = node(E) =:= Node;
 1622: test_node_3(E, Node) when is_reference(E) ->
 1623:     true = node(E) =:= Node.
 1624: 
 1625: node_error(E0) ->
 1626:     E = id(E0),
 1627:     {'EXIT',{badarg,[{erlang,node,[E],_}|_]}} = catch node(E),
 1628:     if
 1629:         node(E) ->
 1630:             ct:fail(should_fail);
 1631:         true ->
 1632:             ok
 1633:     end.
 1634: 
 1635: %% helpers
 1636: 
 1637: busy_wait_go() ->
 1638:     receive
 1639:         {go, Info} ->
 1640:             Info
 1641:     after
 1642:         0 ->
 1643:             busy_wait_go()
 1644:     end.
 1645: 
 1646: id(I) -> I.
 1647: 
 1648: %% Get code path, including the path for the erts application.
 1649: get_code_path() ->
 1650:     Erts = filename:join([code:root_dir(),"erts","preloaded","ebin"]),
 1651:     case filelib:is_dir(Erts) of
 1652: 	true->
 1653: 	    [Erts|code:get_path()];
 1654: 	_ ->
 1655: 	    code:get_path()
 1656:     end.
 1657: 
 1658: which(Mod, Path) ->
 1659:     which_1(atom_to_list(Mod) ++ ".beam", Path).
 1660: 
 1661: which_1(Base, [D|Ds]) ->
 1662:     Path = filename:join(D, Base),
 1663:     case filelib:is_regular(Path) of
 1664: 	true -> Path;
 1665: 	false -> which_1(Base, Ds)
 1666:     end.
 1667: print_mfa({M,F,A}) ->
 1668:     io:format("~p:~p/~p", [M,F,A]).
 1669: 
 1670: extract_abstract(Mod, Path) ->
 1671:     Beam = which(Mod, Path),
 1672:     {ok,{Mod,[{abstract_code,{raw_abstract_v1,Abstr}}]}} =
 1673: 	beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
 1674:     {Mod,Abstr}.
 1675: 
 1676: 
 1677: tok_loop() ->
 1678:     tok_loop(hej).
 1679: 
 1680: tok_loop(hej) ->
 1681:     tok_loop(hopp);
 1682: tok_loop(hopp) ->
 1683:     tok_loop(hej).
